item.description:
Join us for this wonderful event, always a great time. I will not be able to be there until 6:00 or so, but please feel free to get there earlier to take advantage of all the festivities and mingle with fellow members, Lets regroup around 6:00 -6:10 near the side entrance in the main hall where you go downstairs to the theater.

 First Thursday: Moulin Rouge

“Travel” to Paris and enjoy an evening at the Moulin Rouge.  Tour the Medieval to Monet exhibition, listen to a sultry chanteuse, and watch can-can dancing demonstrations/lessons by Connecticut Ballet. Then try to kick up your own heels—oh là là! The champagne will be flowing at the full cash bar and French finger foods will be on the house. Performance by Bated Breath Theatre and make your own tarot or playing cards. Stay for a free screening of the French film Farewell, My Queen at 8 pm.

Free for members, $5 admission.

 PARKING:

Front Street Surface Lot:
1. $7, First Thursdays after 4 pm and Family Second Saturdays (10 am – 4 pm)
2. $19 flat fee for the day

Front Street Garage:
$3 for the first hour; $2 for each additional hour

Trumbull-on-the-Park Garage:
Monday – Friday
$3 Museum Visitor Parking. Visit The Museum Shop to have your ticket validated.

On-Street Parking
Two-hour kiosk parking is available. The kiosks accept coins, debit cards, and credit cards. Display the printed parking receipt on the dashboard inside your vehicle. Parking is free after 6 pm on weekdays and all day on weekends. Please observe posted signs. Some areas are tow zones after 3:30 pm weekdays.
item.how_to_find_us: I will not be there until 6, feel free to get there earlier and mingle, meet me at 6 near that door that goes downstairs to the theater,(side entrance door), I will wear the Black and white scarf with piano keys.
item.name: First Thursday: Moulin Rouge
